greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A117852*A130595 as lower triangular matrices.
comment: Mirror image of triangle in A135091.
Exponential Riordan array [exp(x)*Bessel_I(0,2*x), x] = A007318 * A109187. - _Peter Bala_, Feb 12 2017
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 100 rows, flattened
formula: n-th row polynomial R(n,t) = Sum_{k = 0..floor(n/2)} binomial(n,2*k)*binomial(2*k,k)*(1 + t)^(n-2*k) = coefficient of x^n in the expansion of (1 + (1 + t)*x + x^2)^n.
The polynomials R(n, t - 1) are the row polynomials of A109187.
Moment representation on a finite interval: R(n,t) = 1/Pi * Integral_{x = t-1 .. t+3} x^n/sqrt((t + 3 - x)*(x - t + 1)) dx.
The zeros of the row polynomials appear to lie on the vertical line Re(z) = -1 in the complex plane, and the zeros of R(n,t) and R(n+1,t) appear to interlace along this line.
example: and equals the generalized exponential Riordan array [x + log(Bessel_I(0,2*x), x], and so has integer entries. (End)
mathematica: A002426[n_] := Sum[Binomial[n, 2*k]*Binomial[2*k, k], {k, 0, Floor[n/2]}]; Table[ Binomial[n, k]*A002426[n - k], {n, 0, 99}, {k, 0, n} ]//Flatten (* G_. C. Greubel_, Mar 07 2017 *)
